info.name: Jewellery App - Full Sequential & Bulk Test
info.description:
A sequential, role-based test collection that builds the entire store infrastructure and then runs bulk product creation and filtering tests.

**Test Flow:**
1.  **Admin:** Registers and gets a token.
2.  **Admin:** Creates all core data (Stores, Categories, Attributes, Collections).
3.  **Admin:** Creates a Store Manager user.
4.  **Admin:** Bulk-creates all Products (Rings, Necklaces, Bangles).
5.  **Admin:** Bulk-adds Product Images and Central Stock.
6.  **Store Manager:** Logs in, fails to create a product, succeeds at adding local stock.
7.  **Customer (Anonymous):** Runs all advanced filtering, sorting, and pagination queries.
8.  **Admin:** Logs out.

item.name: 1. ADMIN: Setup & Authentication
item.description: First, the primary Admin user must be created. We use the 'dev-register' endpoint for a quick setup.

exec: pm.test("Access token and Refresh token exist", function () {
// Save variables for all other requests

request.description:
Register the initial Admin user. 
We use `+admin@` in the email because 'AuthenticationServiceImpl.java' has a check for this to assign the ADMIN_ROLE during dev registration.

item.name: 2. ADMIN: Core Infrastructure (Bulk)
item.description: As the Admin, create all the base data needed to define products. (Stores, Categories, Attributes, Collections). All requests in this folder require Admin auth.

body.raw:

item.name: 3. ADMIN: User & Product Setup
item.description: Now that the infrastructure is ready, the Admin can create other users and the products themselves.

request.description: Admin uses the /users endpoint to create a new user with the 'ROLE_STORE_MANAGER'. We save their ID.

item.name: 4. ADMIN: Image & Stock Setup (Bulk)
item.description: Admin adds images and central warehouse stock for all the newly created products.

item.name: 5. STORE MANAGER: Stock Management
item.description: The Store Manager logs in and performs their specific duties.

request.description: The Store Manager logs in with the credentials the Admin created for them. Saves the `storeManagerAccessToken`.

item.name: (FAIL) Store Manager Tries to Create Product

request.description: A security test. The Store Manager (who only has 'ROLE_STORE_MANAGER') should NOT be allowed to create products. We expect a 403 Forbidden.

item.name: (SUCCESS) Store Manager Adds Stock to Store

request.description: This is the Store Manager's correct role. They add stock for a product to their specific store (`mainStoreId`).
The Store Manager updates the stock quantity for the item they just created.
The Store Manager logs out. Their token will be added to the deny list.

item.name: 6. CUSTOMER: Browse & Filter (Bulk)
item.description: An anonymous user (or a logged-in customer) browses the public GET endpoints. No auth token is required. This folder contains all the bulk filtering tests.

exec: pm.test("Product has images and attributes", function () {

item.name: 7. ADMIN: Logout & Cleanup
item.description: The Admin logs out, which invalidates their token.

exec: // Clear the token so it can't be reused
